comment: Not smoky, easy drinking scotch for a nice day
Typical highland scotch for an afternoon bracing
Don't really remember much about the flavor profile but was a nice experience trying it at the distillery in Scotland.
Less refined than the 18 year old but still carries a sweet fruity flavour with a vanilla kick.
A nose of vanilla and caramel is followed by dried fruits, oak, and just the right amount of peaty smoke, finishing with dark chocolate.  Really a lovely dram if you can find it!
Um pouco marcante! Gosto maltado leve e perfumado
A mild spice, but not much else.
This was actually the Glen Ord 15, but can't find it on this app

Fantastic dram, Iike my sherried scotches and this drink smells and taste sugary sweet. With water a caramarl malt starts coming through

Nose:
Thick sweet raisin smell.

Palate:
Mild raisins, smooth feel.

Finish:
More raisins with a quick nip of heat.

Initial Very Smooth. mild

Twirl Smooth

Finish Nice after. Mild Strong.
Beautiful whiskey. Try not adding too much water or ice as the taste quickly changes.

Aroma: especies...
Sabor: naranja, citrico, dulce...
Rich, ripe, and fruity. Juicy red fruits, dried orange peel, and chocolate.

Unusual and quite unique. 

Maybe the first time I come across a whisky that evokes thoughts of Champagne - the nose is winey with citrus zest. The palate has notes of honey and ginger, but the finish is non-existent. 

Not bad.
Extra points for the price. Great everyday
Quite good for starters, seems like Glen Ord is specially made for Asian market.
